DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic Recurrent Unresectable Disease Diagnosis Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to the identification of a disease by the signs and symptoms that has spread from one part of the body to another or is occurring again or is unable to be removed with surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the first identification of a disease by the signs and symptoms that has spread from one part of the body to another or is occurring again or is unable to be removed with surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Metastatic Recurrent Unresectable Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:occurring again.:Unable to be removed with surgery.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
Not capable of being removed by surgery.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Date of diagnosis for recurre
ReferenceDocuments.description: Date of diagnosis for recurrent/metastatic disease or unresectable disease

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
